intro: Thlaspi leblebicii, commonly known as the Levantine cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are usually oval to lance-shaped. It is native to regions in the Mediterranean, including parts of Turkey, Syria, and Lebanon. Thlaspi leblebicii is adapted to thrive in dry, nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
